page.title: 02FARMING NEAR SITTINGBOURNE 1
page.content: The majority of the land is used for the production of fruit and vegetables. Although there are a few smallholdings most of the farms are owned by one farmer. West Tonge Farm produces winter wheat, main crop and early potatoes, corn, spring greens, runner beans and barley. Machinery helps with some of the necessary work: preparing the soil, sowing the seeds and harvesting the crops. A great deal is harvested by hand at the moment as this causes less damage to the crop and ensures better quality, but high wage bills are causing cuts in the work force and more harvesting machinery is being introduced. The vegetables are graded after harvesting. The first class vegetables are sent to local supermarkets, the rest are sent to London wholesale markets.
